name: Palo Alto Networks Firewall
description: This app integrates with the Palo Alto Networks Firewall to support containment and investigative actions

second_device.verbose: Second HA Device IP/Hostname. This device is the second half of a active/passive pair. If this device is provided, a query is made to determine the active device and the action is submitted to the active device.

get_ha_status_timeout.description: Timeout in seconds when determining HA status of nodes

apikey.description: API key. This is used in place of user/password

gateways_for_logout_gpfw_user.description: Default list of gateways for "logoff user" action. Either comma or space separated

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity
actions.verbose: This action logs into the device using a REST Api call to check the connection and credentials configured.

This action does the following to block an URL:
  • Create an URL Filtering profile object named Phantom URL List, if not found.
  • Add the URL to block to this profile.
  • Re-Configure the policy Phantom URL Security Policy to use the created URL Filtering profile.
    The policy is created if not found.
  • Move the policy above the sec_policy if specified, else move it before the first detected allow policy.
  • The action then proceeds to commit the changes.
NOTE: Multiple block url actions will not result in multiple policies.
The Phantom URL Security Policy policy is created with the following properties:
  • from: any
  • to: any
  • source: any
  • destination: any
  • source-user: any
  • category: any
  • service: application-default
  • hip-profiles: any
  • description: Created by Phantom, please don't edit
  • action: allow
  • application: any
.
This action removes the URL from the Phantom URL List object, before proceeding to commit the configuration.

This action uses a multistep approach to block an application:
  • Create an application group named Phantom App List if not found.
    • Add the application to block to this group
  • Configure the application group as the application to the policy named Phantom App Security Policy.
    The policy is created if not found on the device.
  • The action then proceeds to commit the changes.
NOTE: Multiple block application actions will not result in multiple policies or groups. Instead the same App policy and group will be updated.
The Phantom App Security Policy policy is created with the following properties:
  • from: any
  • to: any
  • source: any
  • destination: any
  • source-user: any
  • category: any
  • service: application-default
  • hip-profiles: any
  • description: Created by Phantom, please don't edit
  • action: deny
  • application: Phantom App List

If the action parameter vsys is not specified then 'vsys1' is used by default.

This action removes the app from the Phantom App List object, before proceeding to commit the configuration.
If the action parameter vsys is not specified then 'vsys1' is used by default.

This action uses a multistep approach to block an IP. It behaves differently based upon whether is_source_address is true or not. By default, it is false. The approach is:
  • Create an address entry named '[ip_address] Added By Phantom' with the specified IP address
  • The container id of the phantom action is added as a tag to the address entry when it's created
  • If is_source_address is false:
    • add this entry to an address group called Phantom Network List
    • configure the address group as a destination to the policy named Phantom IP Security Policy.
      The Phantom IP Security Policy policy is created with the following properties:
      • from: any
      • to: any
      • source: any
      • destination: Phantom Network List
      • source-user: any
      • category: any
      • service: application-default
      • hip-profiles: any
      • description: Created by Phantom, please don't edit
      • action: deny
      • application: any
    If is_source_address is true:
    • add this entry to an address group called Phantom Network List Source
    • configure the address group as a source to the policy named Phantom src IP Security Policy.The Phantom src IP Security Policy policy is created with the following properties:
      • from: any
      • to: any
      • source: Phantom Network List Source
      • destination: any
      • source-user: any
      • category: any
      • service: application-default
      • hip-profiles: any
      • description: Created by Phantom, please don't edit
      • action: deny
      • application: any
  • The policy is created if not found on the device.
  • The action then proceeds to commit the changes.
NOTE: Multiple block ip actions will not result in multiple policies or groups.
If the action parameter vsys is not specified then 'vsys1' is used by default.

This action removes the IP from a specific Address Group depending upon whether is_source_address is true. By default, it is false.

if is_source_address is false:
  • This action removes the IP from the Phantom Network List Address Group.
If is_source_address is true:
  • This action removes the IP from the Phantom Network Source list Address Group.

Afterwards, the action proceeds to commit the configuration.
If the action parameter vsys is not specified then 'vsys1' is used by default.

actions.description: List the applications that the device knows about and can block
Get specific information about a user

user_search_string.description: Return entries with the username field beginning with this value

exact_match.description: Return entries exactly matching the user_search_string

user.description: Logout this user from the vpn

domain.description: User's Active Directory domain. If empty, get data from firewall

computer_name.description: User's computer name. If empty, get data from firewall

gateways.description: List of gateways. Either comma or space separated. If empty, use default list from asset configuration

actions.description: Show HA status if second node is configured
